Neural Shot Change Detection: Shot changes are identified at the neurological level via theta and delta frequency band responses, with hippocampal activity supporting perception of these cinematic events.
Cognitive Encoding and Decoding: Theta and delta modulations suggest spectator cognition requires neural processes for encoding and decoding, linked to memory and language processing in the left hemisphere.
Hippocampus and Spatiotemporal Encoding: The study highlights hippocampus involvement in spatial-temporal reality encoding, linking neural activity to how viewers process cinematic shot changes.
Future Experimental Verifications: Two verifications are needed: testing cuts violating spatiotemporal unity and identifying unit changes within shots before exploring linguistic process correlations.
